meanings.definition: Improved in accuracy, delicacy, or excellence.
meanings.sent1: Her refined painting skills impressed everyone at the art show.
meanings.sent2: The chef's refined palate could distinguish even the subtlest flavors.
meanings.sent3: The refined clock that only tells time accurately once a year was a quirky gift.
meanings.sent4: His refined sense of style was like a finely tuned instrument, always on point.
meanings.sent5: The refined details of the sculpture made it a masterpiece to behold.

meanings.definition: Free from impurities or unwanted elements.
meanings.sent1: The refined gold sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The water from the mountain stream was so refined, it tasted pure.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her refined cleaning skills turned her house into a spotless museum.
meanings.sent4: The refined diamond shone with a brilliance untouched by flaws.
meanings.sent5: The refined air in the forest was fresh and invigorating.

meanings.definition: Cultured or sophisticated in manners or taste.
meanings.sent1: The refined lady carried herself with grace and elegance.
meanings.sent2: His refined manners at the dinner party impressed the guests.
meanings.sent3: The refined cat who only ate gourmet food was quite the feline foodie.
meanings.sent4: Her refined taste in music was like listening to a symphony of harmonious notes.
meanings.sent5: The refined atmosphere of the opera house transported the audience to another world.
